captions.text: - I'm a huge fan of Harry Potter.
I've often wondered what did the stuff

that they drink in
Harry Potter taste like?

my whole life has been
leading to this moment.

- This would go great
on a cold winter day.
- This tastes more like liquor than beer.

- Yeah, I had the butterbeer
at Harry Potter World.

They have it chilled,
it's icy there, but...

I think it's better when it's
warm and it's with alcohol.
- Who wouldn't want to have a first date
over a toasty glass of butterbeer?
- So, basically, this is preventing us

from turning into the
werewolves that we're not.

- I don't know if any of the
potions actually taste good.

- They should put some
sugar in that (bleep).

- Looks like I'm about
to start a juice cleanse

- In the books, Polyjuice
Potion tastes nasty.

- And it's supposed to
turn us into somebody else,

if we have a little bit
of their DNA inside.

- Uh, I would wanna turn
into Beyonce, hands down.
- I guess whoever's married to Paul Rudd?

- It's not really love,
it's more like an obsession.

- I would serve that
cocktail at my wedding.
- Would I drink many of these?

No, it only takes one to
find your one true love.
- I only wanna drink unicorn blood.

- Ooh, yeah, that's
some nice unicorn blood.

- Sorry, unicorns, I'm
gonna drink your blood.

- [Woman] Yikes, ugh.
- [Man] All day every day.

God, when you read that
passage, you were like,
I want to go through a day like this.

- This is what I think
cactus would taste like.
- We look like each other, apparently.
All right, you have to, I'm gonna fly.
Get out of my way, I'm gonna fly.

title: Harry Potter Fans Try Harry Potter Potions

comments.author: Abby Tietgen

comments.text:
I literally only scrolled down to see people argue about the pronunciation 
of "accio"

JK Rowling and the guy who reads the audio books pronounce it "assio" so 
some really hard core potterheads say it like that. For a long time, this 
is how I pronounced it. However, most of the spells are based off latin 
words, and there is no soft "c" sound in latin.﻿
